Credibility_Assessment: Board found inconsistencies in dates and events, doubted corroborative evidence
Evidence_Type: Subjective testimony, objective country condition reports
Basis_of_Claim: Political persecution as MDC member in Zimbabwe
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility of applicant and risk to MDC members
Application_Error: Failure to consider objective evidence and procedural unfairness
Review_Outcome: Remanded to a different Board panel for reconsideration
Evidence_Ignored: Objective evidence regarding risks to MDC members in Zimbabwe
Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness and reasonableness of credibility findings
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Did the Board err in rejecting credibility and ignoring objective evidence?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule requiring consideration of all evidence, including country conditions
Cause_of_Refusal: Credibility concerns and perceived lack of corroboration
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of documentary support, ignored country evidence
Procedural_Fairness: Board failed to provide fair hearing by disregarding key evidence
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistent dates and events, questionable corroborative documents
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural unfairness and unreasonable credibility assessment
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada – Federal Court review of refugee determination
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
Procedural_Issue: Failure to consider all relevant evidence and inadequate reasoning
Omission_Type: Failure to address objective country condition evidence
